title: Cambridge South Railway Station
description: A new rail station serving the Cambridge Biomedical Campus and southern Cambridge, providing additional capacity on the West Anglia Main Line.
statusRationale: Works under way following Development Consent Order granted in December 2023.

title: Greater Manchester Bee Network
description: Integrated transport system for Greater Manchester, combining bus franchising, Metrolink, active-travel routes and simplified ticketing under a unified ‘Bee Network’ brand.
statusRationale: Bus franchising launched in 2023; staged expansion and infrastructure build-out continues through the decade.

title: York Central Regeneration
description: A 45-hectare brownfield regeneration scheme behind York rail station, delivering new homes, offices, public realm and transport links.
statusRationale: Infrastructure works funded and under way; first development plots marketed in 2024.

title: Bristol Temple Quarter & St Philip’s Marsh Redevelopment
description: Major regeneration of 130 ha around Bristol Temple Meads station, including mixed-use development, new university campus and station expansion.
statusRationale: Infrastructure funding agreement signed 2023; phased delivery through 2030s.

title: Birmingham Eastside Metro Extension
description: An extension of the West Midlands Metro from Bull Street to Digbeth, linking the city centre with the forthcoming HS2 Curzon Street station.
statusRationale: Utility diversions complete; track-laying began in 2024 with opening targeted for 2027.

title: Northumberland Line Reopening
description: Reinstatement of passenger services between Ashington, Blyth and Newcastle, with six new or rebuilt stations and track upgrades.
statusRationale: Main construction contracts awarded 2023; testing and commissioning scheduled late-2024.

title: Plymouth & South Devon Freeport
description: Freeport programme creating tax-advantaged sites at Oceansgate, Langage and Sherford to drive marine, defence and clean-energy investment.
statusRationale: Government approval granted December 2022; site infrastructure works under way.

title: Leeds Integrated Station Masterplan
description: Comprehensive remodelling of Leeds rail station, adding capacity, new entrances and urban realm, integrated with mass-transit proposals.
statusRationale: Masterplan endorsed 2024; GRIP 3 design phase and funding negotiations in progress.

title: Nottingham Broad Marsh Transformation
description: Redevelopment of the former Broad Marsh shopping centre into a mixed-use district with green public realm, new library, homes and office space.
statusRationale: Demolition complete; enabling works for ‘Green Heart’ park commenced 2024 with phased build-out to 2028.

title: Hoo Peninsula Infrastructure Programme
description: Package of transport and environmental schemes enabling strategic housing growth on the Hoo Peninsula in Medway.
statusRationale: Housing Infrastructure Fund grant confirmed 2021; business cases under review following cost increases.

title: International Advanced Manufacturing Park (IAMP)
description: A 150-hectare manufacturing park on the Sunderland–South Tyneside boundary, creating thousands of jobs in the automotive and renewable-energy supply chains.
statusRationale: Phase 1 infrastructure complete; further plots and Nissan EV battery gigafactory under build through 2027.

title: Mid-Cornwall Metro
description: Rail enhancements linking Newquay, St Austell and Falmouth with through services, new rolling stock and signalling upgrades to create a ‘metro’ frequency.
statusRationale: Awarded £50 m Levelling Up Fund in 2023; detailed design and timetable planning in progress.

title: A350 Melksham Bypass
description: Construction of a new 9 km dual carriageway bypass east of Melksham to relieve congestion on the A350 strategic route.
statusRationale: Preferred route announced 2023; statutory consultation scheduled for late-2025 before DCO submission.

title: Teesside Freeport & Teesworks Infrastructure
description: Delivery of roads, quays and utilities to unlock the 1 800-acre Teesworks site, supporting carbon capture, hydrogen and offshore-wind fabrication clusters.
statusRationale: Seed capital from UK Infrastructure Bank and Levelling Up Fund; new South Bank Quay operational 2024, further works ongoing.

title: Sturry Link Road, Canterbury
description: New highway and viaduct over the railway and River Stour to remove a key bottleneck on the A28 and unlock housing growth at Sturry.
statusRationale: Construction started spring 2023; bridge beams due to be installed in 2024.

title: Durham Bus Station Redevelopment
description: Replacement of Durham’s 1970s bus station with a modern interchange and improved public realm to increase capacity and accessibility.
statusRationale: Main contractor appointed 2023; structural frame rising with completion targeted 2026.

title: South Wokingham Distributor Road
description: Four-phase highway scheme creating a spine road through the South Wokingham strategic development area and new rail bridge at Montague Park.
statusRationale: Phases 1–3 complete; final eastern section and bridge funded via Homes England and due 2026.

title: Exeter Science Park Expansion
description: Additional laboratories, offices and a new mobility hub at Exeter Science Park to support hi-tech growth in the Exeter and East Devon Growth Point.
statusRationale: Levelling Up funding awarded 2024; detailed design progressing for start on site 2025.

title: Carlisle Southern Link Road
description: An 8 km bypass south of Carlisle linking the A595 and M6, unlocking the St Cuthbert’s Garden Village housing development.
statusRationale: Construction began January 2023; bridge works over River Caldew in progress.

title: Sheffield Supertram Renewals Programme
description: Comprehensive track, power and systems renewal of the Sheffield Supertram network to secure its long-term future and enable possible extensions.
statusRationale: Government funding agreement in principle (CRSTS) 2022; procurement and detailed design under way with staged renewals through the 2020s.

title: Leeds Integrated Station Masterplan
description: Comprehensive remodelling of Leeds rail station, adding capacity, new entrances and urban realm, integrated with mass-transit proposals.
statusRationale: Masterplan endorsed 2024; GRIP 3 design phase and funding negotiations in progress.

statusRationale: Demolition complete; enabling works for ‘Green Heart’ park commenced 2024 with phased build-out to 2028.
